Key Match Events: Oklahoma City Thunder earned their 13th consecutive NBA victory
The Thunder scored 31 total points off turnovers in the win
Amir Coffey led Los Angeles with a season-high 26 points
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Thunder, leading the NBA in points off turnovers, cranked up the heat defensively in the third quarter to take control
Over the last two games, Oklahoma City has outscored its opponent 85-43 in the third
Others: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 29 points and Jalen Williams added 18 to help the Thunder move within one win of the franchise’s all-time longest winning streak
Los Angeles — missing James Harden (right groin soreness) for this contest — has lost back-to-back games
Oklahoma City will look to win their 14th straight game on Friday against the New York Knicks
